data.title: Stephan Cieplik on LinkedIn: Excited to be part of a new and promising chapter for the Houston Rockets!‚Ä¶
data.meta_description:
Excited to be part of a new and promising chapter for the Houston Rockets!

Looking forward to the journey ahead and working with an amazing team üöÄ Gretchen‚Ä¶ | 146 comments on LinkedIn
data.text: The Houston Rockets have named Stephan Cieplik their Chief Revenue Officer to lead the organization‚Äôs efforts in partnership sales and development, ticketing, and premium sales. "We are thrilled to welcome Stephan into the Houston Rockets family," said Rockets President of Business Operations Gretchen Sheirr. "Stephan brings extensive experience in successfully commercializing sports property rights on the global stage. As we enter this new and exciting chapter for our franchise and Toyota Center, Stephan's expertise will be instrumental in identifying and capitalizing on opportunities for growth.‚Äù "I am excited to join the Houston Rockets - a true global basketball household name with a rich history and core values that resonate with me," said Rockets Chief Revenue Officer Stephan Cieplik. "I am impressed by their vision and growth ambition, and I look forward to bringing my leadership experience as well as my global expertise into the organization to help maximize revenue opportunities." Prior to joining the Rockets, Cieplik served as CRO of TSM, which is recognized as one of the top esports organizations in the world. Before working with TSM, he spent nearly a decade with City Football Group and the Manchester City Football Club. Cieplik started as their Director of Sales and eventually became Senior Vice President of Global Partnership Sales. With the contribution of commercial revenues under his leadership, in 2021-22, Manchester City recorded a record revenue of ¬£613million ($692m) and for the second straight year, topped the Deloitte Money League, which is a ranking of worldwide football clubs by generated revenue. During his tenure, the club announced over 100 partnership deals with over 90 different brands for City Football Group, including kit sponsorships for their various clubs. A native of Germany, Cieplik also worked in sales and business development for Total Spots Asia and the Asian Football Confederation. He pursued a professional career in football/soccer before focusing on his sports business career. Cieplik will report to President of Business Operations Gretchen Sheirr. The Rockets partnered with SRI, an executive search and talent consultancy firm, to conduct an extensive search for the ideal candidate to assume the position of Chief Revenue Officer. ‚ÄúThe Rockets have an enviable brand, proud history and highly respected leadership team, so we were delighted to conduct a global search for their next Chief Revenue Officer," said SRI Sports Partner Jeff Yocum. "The future of the organization is bright, which was quickly recognized by some of the top talent in the sports, media and entertainment industry. We‚Äôre thrilled with Stephan‚Äôs hire and believe he will be an amazing addition to the organization.‚Äù
